title: Is anyone else experiencing Ping spikes in team fights?
body: This happens most times when I have a lead in the game. I will be running 35-47 ms with 60+ frames per sec. Once I get a lead and we are stomping the enemy team our pings start spiking not just me but everyone's pings start spiking to 1.4k-2k and I watch as my character freezes in place to then end up gray screened. I checked my internet and I am running just fine, no latency issues server end at all. Any time I am near an enemy champion my ping will spike to ridiculous heights then return to normal once I'm dead. This doesn't happen every game but when it does Its 9/10 once we have pulled a lead and starting to stomp. Just curious as if others are experiencing this...

replies.body:
This could be happening for one of two reasons. Either your network keeps hitting these hiccups when teamfights breakout from not having a solid connection, or your ISP is having some problems with packet loss which is affecting your gameplay pretty heavily. 

First, verify your network is setup in the best way to reach our servers reliably by updating some settings with this [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). Pay extra attention to the points on port forwarding and how you can configure your DNS settings. Be sure to test this in a custom game to avoid potential leaverbusters.

If that doesn't seem to be helping, go ahead and grab the network logs from a game that had those crazy ping spikes and let this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) scan them. After, take a screenshot of the image it gives you and post it here so that I can take a look for any packet loss.
